description:
When creating an image duplicate image names are allowed.  It seems like it would make it hard to figure out what image is actually what even using the information within the metadata.

steps to reproduce:
create image, named "whatever"
list images to verify "whatever" was created
create another image named "whatever"
list images and see that two images named "whatever" are now listed

I expected create_image to require a unique name
title: duplicate image names allowed

comments.content: I personally don't think this is a bug. We have unique identifiers (in the form of uuids) when the client needs to be able to tell individual images apart. The name is not required to be unique to allow the most flexibility to the end user. It is also unclear at what level one would define 'unique': per deployment, per registry, per tenant? Keep in mind that the application consuming the API may enforce its own uniqueness.
